description: Deletes a file system, permanently severing access to its contents.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: This technique involves deleting files to remove indicators of malicious activity. Deleting a file system would effectively remove all contents, which could include logs or evidence of malicious actions.
This technique includes manipulating data stored in systems. Deleting a file system manipulates the stored data by permanently removing it.
This technique involves removing access to accounts or systems. Deleting a file system removes access to the data contained within, impacting users ability to access critical information.

File deletion focuses on the removal of files to impact data availability or to hide malicious activity. Deleting a file system in AWS EFS results in the removal of all files and directories within that file system.

researchLinks.description: AWS EFS File System or Mount Deleted

securityImplications: Attackers might use DeleteFileSystem in AWS EFS to deliberately erase file systems, leading to data loss.
